intro: Lippia velutina, commonly known as velvetleaf lippia, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along riverbanks. Lippia velutina is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
